thread.title: Buckeye teacher accused of sexual conduct with foreign exchange student
thread.title_full: Buckeye teacher accused of sexual conduct with foreign exchange student

author: Brianna Bradley , The Republic | azcentral.com
title: Buckeye teacher accused of sexual conduct with foreign exchange student
text:
Goodyear police say Joshua Schroder, a teacher at Rainbow Valley Elementary School in Buckeye, was engaging in sexual conduct with a foreign-exchange student. Joshua Schroder. (Photo: Goodyear Police Department) 
61 CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN 1 COMMENT EMAIL MORE A Buckeye elementary school teacher is accused of having sexual conduct with a 17-year-old foreign exchange student, Goodyear police say.
Joshua Schroder, 36, who teaches at Rainbow Valley Elementary School and coordinates a foreign exchange program, was arrested Sunday, police said.
The student's host parents reported the inappropriate relationship to the Goodyear Police Department, said police spokeswoman Lisa Kutis.
Schroder was booked into a Maricopa County jail on suspicion of nine counts of sexual conduct with a minor and two counts of contributing to the delinquency of a minor.
"The teacher has been reassigned to home and will be prohibited from being on district property and having contact with any district students or staff," Superintendent Andy Rogers said in a letter posted to the Liberty Elementary School District website. "Once the district has gathered further information, we will take appropriate action regarding the employment of Mr. Schroder."
Check back with azcentral.com for more details.
